turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Gray ooze.
turn.1: What is the Dungeons and Dragons Gray ooze?
turn.2: Gray ooze In the "Dungeons & Dragons" fantasy role-playing game, the gray ooze is an ooze.
turn.4: It resembles a thick, viscous puddle of gray sludge, roughly 6 to 8 inches thick and up to 14 feet across, and often closely resembles wet stone or an amorphous rock formation.
turn.6: The gray ooze first appeared in the original "Dungeons & Dragons" set (1974), and also appeared in the supplement "Eldritch Wizardry" (1976). The gray ooze appeared in the "D&D Basic Set" (1977, 1981, 1983) and "Dungeons & Dragons Rules Cyclopedia" (1991).
turn.7: Was there another edition of it?
turn.8: The gray ooze appeared in first edition "Advanced Dungeons & Dragons" in the original "Monster Manual" (1977).
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The gray ooze appeared in second edition "Advanced Dungeons & Dragons" in "Monstrous Compendium Volume One" (1989), reprinted in the "Monstrous Manual" (1993) under the "ooze" entry.
turn.11: Was there another edition after that?
turn.12: The psionic variant of the grey ooze appeared in "The Complete Psionics Handbook" (1991).
